alert.note: Alert for Buchanan; Dickenson (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 4:49AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Dickenson, Buchanan, McDowell, Mingo, western Wyoming and southern Logan Counties through 530 AM EDT... At 448 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Hatfield Station to Norton. Movement was east at 65 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Williamson, Welch, Clintwood, Grundy, Pineville, Haysi, John Flannagan Lake, Breaks Interstate, Davenport, Oceana, War, Man, Delbarton, Gilbert Creek, Mallory, South Williamson, Hinch, Hanover, R.d. Bailey Lake and Trammel. This includes Route 119 between mile markers 1 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
